entry.title: Xapo Bank Becomes First Bank To Offer Bitcoin Lightning Payments
entry.summary: Xapo is partnering with Lightspark to allow its customers to send bitcoin near-instantaneously to any vendor who accepts BTC over Lightning. Gibraltar-licensed private bank Xapo Bank has partnered with Lightspark, the startup spearheaded by former Facebook crypto lead David Marcus, to integrate the Lightning Network and enable near-instant bitcoin payments for its customers.Â Xapo Bank members can now make small purchases of up to $100 USD at any vendor that accepts Lightning payments, without high transaction fees and long blockchain confirmation waiting times. This integration will make Xapo Bank the first fully licensed private bank to offer Lightning payments. The Lightning Network enables scalable payments at millions of transactions per second across the network, reducing the time-câ€¦

entry.title: Coinbase-Silvergate Partnership Ends, Shares Plummet 80%
entry.summary:
Cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase recently announced the end of its relationship with California-based crypto-friendly bank Silvergate. The exchange has stated that it will no longer accept or initiate payments to or from the bank.Â
Coinbase has mentioned its â€œabundance of cautionâ€ in light of recent developments due to the delay of its former partner Silvergateâ€™s annual report. The exchange has also said that all customer funds will remain â€œsafe, accessible, and available.â€ Coinbase added:
Coinbase will be facilitating institutional client cash transactions with our other banking partners and have taken proactive action to help ensure that clients experience no impact from this change.
Furthermore, Coinbase has stated that there will be no changes to its fiat withdrawal process follâ€¦

entry.title: Biggest Movers: ADA Hits Multi-Week Low, as Red Wave Hits Crypto Markets
entry.summary:
Cardano fell to a multi-week low on March 2, as cryptocurrency prices were mostly lower in todayâ€™s session. The global market cap has mostly declined on Thursday, and is trading 1.71% lower as of writing. Cosmos was also in the red, with prices retreating to a key price floor.
Cardano (ADA)
Cardano (ADA) dropped to a multi-week low on Thursday, as prices collided with a key support point.
ADA/USD plunged to an intraday low of $0.3501 in todayâ€™s session, following a high of $0.3637 on Wednesday.
As a result of the move, cardano traded slightly above a floor at $0.3500, which is its weakest point since February 13.
Looking at the chart, one of the catalysts for the move was a downward crossover between the 10-day (red), and 25-day (blue) moving averages.
In addition to this, the relative strength index (RSI) also failed to climb above a ceiling at 45.00.
At the time of writing, the RSI is now tracking at 41.68, and appears to be heading for a floor at 40.00.
Cosmos (ATOM)
Additionally, cosmos (ATOM) also fell back into the red, as prices retreated to a recent floor.
Following a high of $12.91 on Wednesday, ATOM/USD dropped to a low of $12.26 earlier in todayâ€™s session.
The move saw the token fall below a long-term support point of $12.30, nearing a six-week low in the process.
Overall, cosmos is down by over 10% in the last seven days, which comes as the RSI continued to fall towards a floor at 40.00.
As of writing, the index is tracking at 40.99, which is near its weakest point in the last two months.
Should price strength hit its targeted floor, ATOM will likely be trading close to the $12.00 mark.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Could cosmos fall below $12.00 this week? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.title: Leaving Your Wallet Behind: Pros and Cons of Digital Wallets
entry.summary:
Digital wallets have grown in popularity in recent years, allowing consumers to use their smartphones to make payments, store loyalty cards, and even access identification and insurance cards.

But what are the benefits and drawbacks of ditching your physical wallet in favor of a digital one? In this article, we will look at the benefits and drawbacks of digital wallets.

Benefits of Digital Wallets

  • Convenience: One of the most significant advantages of digital wallets is convenience. You no longer need to carry around a physical wallet containing multiple cards, cash, and coins if you use a digital wallet. Payments can be made with a few taps on your smartphone, making transactions faster and easier.
  • Security: Digital wallets offeâ€¦

entry.title: Stablecoins and Financial Inclusion: Use Cases and Challenges in 2023
entry.summary:
Stablecoins have emerged as a new type of cryptocurrency in recent years, aiming to provide stability in the volatile world of cryptocurrency. While cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin and Ethereum are notorious for their price volatility, stablecoins are intended to maintain a stable value in relation to a traditional currency or asset.

Because of this stability, stablecoins have become an appealing option for those looking to gain access to financial services and participate in the global economy, particularly those who are unbanked or underbanked. This article will look at the applications and challenges of stablecoins in promoting financial inclusion.

What are Stablecoins?

Stablecoins are cryptocurrencies that are intended to keep their valueâ€¦

entry.title: US Treasury and White House to Hold Regular Meetings on CBDCs and Payment Innovations
entry.summary:
On March 1, 2023, Nellie Liang, undersecretary for domestic finance at the U.S. Treasury, delivered a speech to the Atlantic Council in Washington concerning the subject of central bank digital currencies (CBDCs). Liang detailed during her speech that a CBDC is one of several options for â€œupgrading the legacy capabilities of central bank money,â€ and members of the Treasury, Biden administration and the Federal Reserve â€œwill begin to meet regularlyâ€ to discuss the topic.
U.S. Treasuryâ€™s Nellie Liang Discusses Key Considerations in Developing a CBDC
The undersecretary for domestic finance at the U.S. Treasury, Nellie Liang, gave a speech at the Atlantic Council titled â€œNext Steps in the Future of Money and Payments.â€ During the speech, Liang discussed U.S. President Joe Bidenâ€™s executiveâ€¦

entry.summary: The gaming community hasn't shown much affection for NFTs, but the Worldwide Webb founder thinks that could soon change.

entry.title: Term Labs Raises $2.5M to Build Out Fixed-Rate Product for DeFi
entry.summary: Term Labs is building out a key primitive for the DeFi space, allowing crypto projects to lock in fixed rates on their idle holdings.

entry.title: Ethereum Edges Closer to Letting Users Withdraw Staked ETH
entry.summary: Sepolia is the second Ethereum testnet to see a dress rehearsal for Shanghai, which will finally let users withdraw their staked ETH.

entry.title: TeraWulfâ€™s Nuclear Bitcoin Plant Is Just One Piece of the Green Mining Puzzle
entry.summary: Terawulfâ€™s newest nuclear-powered Bitcoin miner in Pennsylvania isnâ€™t the firmâ€™s first attempt at going green.

entry.title: Bitcoin NFT Mints Surpass 200Kâ€”But Is Interest in Ordinals Fading?
entry.summary: Miner fees have tanked from $170K to $11K in less than two weeksâ€”but a new Yuga Labs project may rekindle things.

entry.title: Yat Siu of Animoca Brands: 'The Future of Crypto and Web3 Is Culture'
entry.summary: Animoca Brands chairman Yat Siu spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about the open metaverse, NFTs and gaming, building through a bear market, and why Animoca believes the future of the industry is culture and gaming.

entry.title: COO of Move-to-Earn App STEPN: 'We're Thriving, Not Just Surviving'
entry.summary: Shiti Manghani, COO of Stepn, the app that lets users earn tokens for exercising, spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about Stepn's current health, its plans to addnew achievement systems for the top users, and parent company Finding Satoshi Labs and its plans to launch more apps.

entry.title: Bored Ape Yacht Club Creator Yuga Labs Reveals First Bitcoin NFT Project
entry.summary: TwelveFold, a limited series of just 300 generative Ordinals NFT art pieces on Bitcoin, will be auctioned later this week.

entry.title: Robinhood Faces SEC Investigation Over Crypto Business
entry.summary: The SEC hit Robinhood with a subpoena in December regarding the company's crypto listings and custody of assets, the firm disclosed today.

entry.title: Winning â€˜Dookey Dashâ€™ Key NFT Sells to Billionaire for $1.63 Million in Ethereum
entry.summary: â€œFortniteâ€ esports star Mongraal has accepted a 1,000 ETH bid for his NFT after achieving the highest score on Yuga Labsâ€™ game.

entry.title: Gamers Will Drive Web3 Adoption: Polygon Labs President Ryan Wyatt
entry.summary: Despite the NFT backlash, the ex-YouTube Gaming head believes that gamers will eventually embrace Web3.

entry.title: gm: Ryan Wyatt on Polygonâ€™s Winning Streak
entry.summary: Polygon Labs President Ryan Wyatt, the former YouTube Gaming head, helped turn Polygon into one of the crypto industryâ€™s rare winners in 2022. In a lively chat with Dan Roberts and Andrew Hayward, he revealed why the promise of digital ownership pushed him from the gaming world into crypto, and how Polygon has pulled giants like Starbucks, Reddit, and Instagram into Web3. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: NFT Paris Founder Alexandre Tsydenkov Previews 2023 Event
entry.summary: NFTs take over Paris on February 23. Decrypt's Stephen Graves interviews NFT Paris founder Alexandre Tsydenkov about this year's conference, which features speakers from many of the top collections and companies in the space, plus lots of side events. Decrypt will be on hand as a media partner, conducting interviews and moderating panels. See you in France!

entry.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner: Web3 Can Solve Twitch's Limitations
entry.summary: Paul Bettner tells Decrypt about the challenges he faced while developing his Web3 game "Wildcard."

entry.title: 'Words with Friends' Creator Paul Bettner on Why He's Building His Next Game 'Wildcard' in Web3
entry.summary: Paul Bettner shares his perspective on Web3 gaming platforms and his vision to make games everywhere and anywhere players want them.

entry.title: gm Week in Review: SEC Targets Staking, a16z Doesnâ€™t Get Its Way, NFTs Popping
entry.summary: In our February 11, 2023 week in review episode, Matthew Diemer, Stacy Elliott, and Stephen Graves talk about the latest developments in the FTX case, 3AC founders trying for a comeback, a16z losing on a big Uniswap vote despite holding 15 million UNI tokens, and NFTs roaring back with CryptoPunks, Bored Apes, and Ordinals NFTs selling hot. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
